Zhi Gao Ph.D

Professor Zhi Gao is a professor at the School of Remote Sensing and Information Engineering, Wuhan University. His main research interests include artificial intelligence, computer vision, and remote sensing for intelligent unmanned reconnaissance systems. Previously, he was a research scientist at Temasek Laboratories, National University of Singapore. He received his Ph.D. from Wuhan University.

  • üì∫ Demo: https://maverick.canhtran.me

item.title: About
item.description:
Maverick is a minimalistic Hugo blogging theme. The theme is inspired from Poole and Listed

Features

  • Minimalistic, clean and simple design
  • Responsive design
  • Inline CSS
  • Anchor headings
  • Tags
  • 404 page
  • Compressed CSS and HTML
  • 100/100 score on Lighthouse, Page Speed Insights & Webpagetest
  • Robots.txt
  • Ultra fast
  • Github comment

item.title: Zhi Gao Ph.D
item.description:
Zhi Gao Ph.D

Professor and Ph.D. Supervisor
School of Remote Sensing and Information Engineering, Wuhan University
Discipline Leader in Remote Sensing
Deputy Dean, Academy of Engineering Excellence, Wuhan University

üìß gaozhinus@gmail.com
üìß gaozhinus@whu.edu.cn

Biography

  • Recipient of the National Young Thousand Talents Program

  • Distinguished Professor of the Chutian Scholars Program, Hubei Province

  • Hubei Provincial Outstanding Young Scientist

  • Principal Investigator of Major Projects funded by the National Natural Science Foundation of China (NSFC)
